net.srussell.framework.assessment

Class EmailDelivery

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.srussell.framework.assessment.EmailDelivery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, AssessmentDeliverDelegate

    public class EmailDelivery
extends java.lang.Object
implements AssessmentDeliverDelegate, java.io.Serializable
    EmailDelivery delegate provides email delivery for an assessment. 

         Example:
     Assessment ass = new Assessment( "sample assessment, delivered via email" );
     EmailDelivery delegate = new EmailDelivery( "smtp_recipient@host.domain",
                                                 "an e-mail subject",
                                                 "smtp_originator@host.domain" );
     ass.setDeliverDelegate( delegate );
     ass.deliver();
    Since:
    1.0
    Copyright © Scott M. Russell, 2010
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Scott Russell
    See Also:
    AssessmentDeliverDelegate, Assessment, Serialized Form

      • EmailDelivery

        public EmailDelivery(java.lang.String toAddress)
        minimal constructor that supplies default values for from, subject, and smtp server.
        it uses the to address as the from address and "localhost" as the SMTP server
        Parameters:
        toAddress - String - email recipient
        Since:
        1.0

      • validateSmtpAddress

        public static java.lang.String validateSmtpAddress(java.lang.String inAddress,
                                                   java.lang.String replacementIfInvalidAddress)
        validate a SMTP address by trying to construct an InternetAddress object from it. If an AddressException occurs, use the replacement address. The replacement address is also validated. If both are invalid, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        inAddress - String - address to validate
        replacementIfInvalidAddress - String - address to use if the inAddress is invalid. (can be null)
        Returns:
        String - the SMTP address to be used. null if both input address are invalid.
